intro: Protium roxburghiana, commonly known as the Indian beech, is a deciduous tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mixed forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is valued in both horticulture and conservation efforts.
